# Bivariate analysis Gender

```{r}
# try something
answer_levels <- c("Strongly disagree", "Disagree", "Neither agree nor disagree",
                   "Agree", "Strongly agree", 
                   "This topic is not relevant to my research", 
                   "Don’t know/ Don’t have enough information")

gender_df <- df %>% 
  select(starts_with("A10["), E2) %>% 
  mutate(across(.fns = factor, levels = answer_levels))


gender_df %>%
  select(E2, `A10[SQ001]`) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(value) %>%
         value != "Don’t know/ Don’t have enough information") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(E2, fill = `A10[SQ001]`)) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Title")

gender_df %>%
  select(E2, `A10[SQ001]`) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(value) %>%
         value != "Don’t know/ Don’t have enough information") %>%

  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Title")

```
